location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.3165 of 1853 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter enclosing an extract (folio 173) from a despatch from the Honourable Court of Directors, dated 4 May 1853. The extract notes that there have been 'irregularities' against the Maritime Treaty committed over time, and that Kemball's has adopted 'the proper course' in these offences. However, the extract notes, Lieutenant Tronson's conduct in proposing the punishment of 'a dozen lashes' to the crew of an offending vessel was inappropriate, and that Tronson was 'properly warned of his error' by Kemball.
